other_tests.findings: Significant improvement in wounds; granulating tissue began to grow and the amount of necrotic tissue was reduced.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After 5 weeks, a superficial soft-tissue defect was covered with autologous mesh grafts; at 5 months, all tissue defects had healed.

other_tests.findings: Local inflammation rapidly decreased, and the condition of the lower extremity and upper leg improved.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Within 1 week, signs of infection were subsiding, and the wound showed signs of granulation; wound was treated with a combination of maggots and PVA foam for 2 weeks, and finally covered with a mesh graft transplant.
